website_summaries.verdict: Surpasses its competitors in almost every way – quality ingredients with nothing artificial and a flavor most cats devour.
pros: Popular, wholesome recipe that doesn't include grain, artificial ingredients, or by-products
Has fruits, vegetables, probiotics, and antioxidants, plus extra nutrients not found in other foods
cons: It's expensive, and caused some cats digestive upset
Several reports of cats not eating it

website_summaries.verdict: A delicious, healthy and grain- and gluten-free option for cats.
pros: Features a grain-free and high-protein formula
Designed for cats of all ages and needs
cons: Cats sometimes experience urinary issues when they transition from their current cat food to Blue Wilderness

website_summaries.verdict: A protein-rich cat food that promotes healthy eating and regular digestion.
pros: Contains prebiotic fibers to help with digestion
Ideal for indoor and outdoor cats
Life-source bits add plenty of vitamins and antioxidants
Grain-free recipe includes natural ingredients like chicken, blueberries, cranberries, and kelp
cons: Kibbles are smaller than most, and may not appeal to all cats

customer_reviews.title: INGREDIENTS CHANGED IN JUNE 2017 FOR THE WORST
customer_reviews.text: My cats favorite food of 10 years has been changed for the worst. My cat started throwing up 3 times a week. I had taken her to the vet and figured out it was the change of the ingredients. This change of ingredients has affected the chicken, salmon and duck recipes. Please check out the ingredients. The third ingredient was TURKEY MEAL. Now it's PEA PROTEIN. No nutrition value at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is Making My Pets Throw Up
customer_reviews.text: It has made my cats sick. Since I started this food 2 have been throwing up and 1 has diarrhea. I am throwing away this junk and asking for a refund. My cats have eaten it in the past and I believe the formula has either changed as many reviewers are saying or this package from Amazon is old/ or somehow different. My cats are used to eating high proteim food \ grain free as well as rotating to Royal Canin and Science Diet. They are never sick with stomach problems as I am very careful of their diet. As soon as they ate this the stomach issues began.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Blue Wilderness vs. Purina One
customer_reviews.text: We adopted our cat from the SPCA. He was throwing up every day. Do not know what food he was eating at the SPCA, so we started with Purina One indoor. Improved to every other day. Slowly introduced Blue, but no improvement. Actually made it worse. We purchased this product to help keep my cat from throwing up. We switched back to Purina One Indoor and it seems to be working. Not saying Blue is bad, it just didn't work for our cat.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Toxic Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to write a review such as this, but I am being honest and I love my 3 cats very much. About 1 week after introducing this food to my cats, my Himalayan cat was feeling bad and her left eye was swollen. I thought she had been injured. I cleaned her eye with eye wash and put in eye drops. My cat Gina's eyes were watering like crazy and she was wheezing. I took away the food and the reaction to this food went away. This batch of food should be recalled as I believe it is TOXIC! It could be the salmon?? but I am not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best cat food says my cat.
customer_reviews.text: My cat, Kitty J. Cat, had a weight problem. She also had several other health issues. I have tried many different cat foods to try and solve the problem. I bought he a cat diet food. Her response to that was to poop and pee everywhere. Finally, I discovered this Blue Wilderness food and I carefully measure her food for breakfast and dinner. She has lost the excess weight so she can no jump on my bed to wake me up so I will feed her. Her coat is shiny, thick and healthy. She hasn't had any health issues this past year. If you consider the vet savings this food is really inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: T. C. Bryson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cat food
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. My cat is 3 yrs old Norwegian Forrest cat and loves it.So glad I switched. First of all the food smells great because he runs when I open the bag. His stool does not smell and is solid and best part of it all is that this cat food is filling. He eats less of it because it is truly full of nutrients. Not to say anything bad about another brand but when I used purina Finley was eating so so much more of it. And his stool with purina had a really strong smell to it. His coat even looks better now.
customer_reviews.author: firas issa

customer_reviews.title: INGREDIENTS HAVE CHANGED FOR THE WORSE
customer_reviews.text: Cat loved this food for 10 years. Then they changed the third ingredient from Turkey MEAL TO PEA PROTEIN in June 2017. Made my cat sick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning:  New owners, not the same quality as it was a few years ago
customer_reviews.text: Blue Buffalo was sold to General Mills in the spring of 2018 and something has gone very wrong with it. I had been buying Blue Buffalo Wilderness Duck dry cat food for my cats for several years and they were doing well on it. The last bags I purchased caused both of my cats to get very ill. The female cat developed arthritis in one foreleg. The male cat knew something was wrong with it and quit eating and got very thin. Both vomited every time they ate it. Got them onto a different food and they are both recovering-no longer vomit, the female gradually quit limping and the male cat is beginning to put back some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Linda W.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Blue Buffalo is great cat food. I have 4 cats who love all the flavors of the dry and canned food. It costs more than many other brands but is so worth it. I have 2 senior cats, 14 years old, who were starting to have kidney problems. I switched them to Blue Buffalo and in 6 weeks the issues cleared up. I pay more in the short term, but in the long run I save big money on vet bills. There is also the better quality of life and longer life my fur babies have. If I ever get a dog, he’s going to be on Blue Buffalo too.
customer_reviews.author: Leia Clark

customer_reviews.title: Made our cat very very sick!
customer_reviews.text: This made our cat sick. We have had the other flavors of Blue Wilderness with no issues, but with this one she ended up getting so sick we took her to the vet and had to get her on antibiotics for a UTI. So this bag ended up costing us 200+ dollars. Because of this experience I will not be ordering any more cat food off of Amazon or from Blue Wilderness. Its just not worth the risk for us.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: So healthy and good for our boys!
customer_reviews.text: Our two Siamese boys LOVE this food. It came highly recommended by their foster mom and they are almost one year old now. We were feeding them the Kitten version and have now transitioned from kitten to Adult version. They are super healthy and their bowel habit have always been healthy too since we brought them home at 2 months old. They are fully indoor cats. You can tell how much they love Blue Buffalo food by their determination of trying to get more..
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Yang

customer_reviews.title: Great quality ingredients but recipe causes urinary problems in cats
customer_reviews.text: Three cats in our family developed struvite crystals in their bladders after about 6 months of eating a mix of this kibble and wet canned food. We switched natures variety instinct grain free kibble and so far so good. The fact that my cats never had issues before eating Blue buffalo, and haven't had any since they stopped, says a lot. Use at your own peril
customer_reviews.author: Maria Lebron

customer_reviews.title: Not Authentic
customer_reviews.text: We noticed our cat to begin to have skin issues. Our vet asked about the food. When we went and bought another flavor and compared this purchase from Amazon was nothing like the food purchased at the pet store. Since switch to the food from the pet store we have had no issues!! We also had a problem with dog food. We will no longer purchase pet food from Amazon as we do not feel it is of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal G

customer_reviews.title: Made my cat extremely sick
customer_reviews.text: This food made our cat extremely sick, he couldn't stop throwing up so I had to take him to the vet. 500+ dollars later we found out that this product was the problem. Do not buy this food, look at all the comments! So many people have complained about this food making their cat sick.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim Khan

customer_reviews.title: Causes urinary tract congestion, STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: TL; DR: STAY AWAY FROM THIS BRAND We were fooled into switching to this brand by the higher price tag and number of "good" reviews on Amazon. Our cat had zero health issue before, but has had two episodes of urinary tract congestion since the switch. My vet also said they've seen a lot of similar cases of urinary problems caused by whatever unknown ingredients in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bah

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the duck formula for them this time and both cats (8 and 15 years old) became horribly constipated and began vomiting like never before
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been feeding BLUE Wilderness to my 2 cats for a number of years. I purchased the duck formula for them this time and both cats (8 and 15 years old) became horribly constipated and began vomiting like never before. I was super disappointed. After 2 weeks of hoping they’d adjust I threw the rest of the bag of food away. My older cat’s intestines have not recovered from the duck food after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Struvite Crystals
customer_reviews.text: Stay away! Seems to be healthy, but it gives my cats UTI's. EDIT: Gives them struvite crystals (not UTI's)
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Christl

customer_reviews.title: Itching, scratching, sores on ears
customer_reviews.text: This food made my cat sick. She started itching, scratching and licking like crazy. There are sores and loss of fur on her ear. She is also drinking copious amounts of water. I took her to the vet this morning and they said stop feeding her this food and put her back on Natural Balance. The vet gave her a steroid shot of Depro Medrol. Vet bill $64.55.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An absofreakinlutely great brand!
customer_reviews.text: Mousie aka Mighty Mouse started out with us as a 3 day old (we think) orphan. By the time he was old enough for dry food, we were feeding him an overpriced food recommended by our veterinarian. Then we discovered Blue Buffalo! He'd rejected EVERY other food we offered as an alternative, so we were braced for more rejection. Nope! That boy is a MONSTER and he loooooves this food. He is still picky and won't accept any FLAVOR change, but he has NO problem with eating this to the bottom of the bowl! Wouldn't DARE stop buying it! He's now over 22 pounds of muscle and floof!
customer_reviews.author: Rae Norsworthy

customer_reviews.title: Pantry beetles
customer_reviews.text: We got pantry beetles :( it’s more Worthwhile to be able to inspect a bag and store shelves before purchase. It is an absolute pain to get rid of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C.

customer_reviews.title: Probably a Great Product, But My Cat Hates It!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, it's an issue, because the instructions tell you to gradually mix it in with the old food beginning with small quantities and gradually building up. My cat has such a dislike for the flavor that she picks it out and leaves it in the bowl. I've even mixed it together with the Instinct soft can food and she still leaves the Wilderness. I guess she just refuses to eat it and it may not be a problem for all cats, but it is an expensive bag of food for a failed trial run when Instinct dry food seems to be near or of the same quality and she is perfectly happy with that. JMO.
customer_reviews.author: gamecockks

customer_reviews.title: Even picky eater's like it
customer_reviews.text: My cats are picky eaters. Any time I have changed their food in the past they refused to eat it for a few day (until they got hungry enough). With this food all 3 of them ate it on the first day it was introduced to them. I switched away from Science Diet because I found out it was loaded with Grain "fillers" that cat's shouldn't have in their diet, as they are meant to eat protein, not carbs. I'm waiting to see if they lose any weight from getting off their high carb - grain diet.
customer_reviews.author: Net-Shop`R

customer_reviews.title: Won't purchase again!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag and dumped into my sealed car food storage container and put some in my cats auto dispensing container..... A week later there were bugs in both locations so there was obviously larvae/eggs in the bag. I didn't contact the seller I just disposed of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great food, kittahs love it
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with this brand, I used it for many years when my older cats were alive. They both lived to be 19 and 20 yrs old. When I got new kittens I put them on it as well. Those little kittens are still doing great and now almost 2 yrs old. They have no hairballs either with this food which is stellar. I’ve had better luck with all my cats liking the duck flavor versus the chicken or fish ones. I hope it works for your kittahs too!
customer_reviews.author: UrbanBlonde

customer_reviews.title: I DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely refused to eat BB. He backed away just at the scent of this cat food. He is 14 and I've NEVER seen him back away and refuse to eat his food!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great hedgehog food
customer_reviews.text: This is what we've been feeding our hedgehog for the last 4 years (since we got him) and he literally will not eat anything else. I know some hedgehogs do eat fruits and veggies but ours won't. I guess that's testimony to how tasty this cat food is? He also seems to be pretty healthy, running on his wheel in the middle of the night and such. I love that when my 13 year old forgets to tell me that Hedgie is out of food until when it's gone, Amazon can have it at the house the next day. It's kind of hard to find locally in stores. Either way, here's a picture of a cute hedgehog.
customer_reviews.author: Angela_GTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: My big guy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has only ever eaten Blue Buffalo dry food (he's an energetic, 2 yr. old huge beefcake now). He started with kitten formula and then we moved from Salmon to the Rocky Mountain Blend for a long time (which was crazy delicious, he said) and actually he likes this dry food brand so much that he chooses it over the wet gravy gloopy stuff frequently...aaaand now he's into chicken again. For someone who wavers between 16 pounds in winter and 15 in the hot months...he's always had a huge appetite and he does really well for protein with this brand. Kitties are so finicky and I'm grateful that they offer so many flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Farmcat Approved.
customer_reviews.text: The cats go berserk for this salmony micro-kibble. Not overly stinky. Great ingredients. I really like Blue Buffalo products.
customer_reviews.author: Reiki Chef Farmboy

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive stomachs and picky eaters
customer_reviews.text: My cat developed several food sensitivities as she got older. We tried countless kinds of limited ingredient or grain free products, including other Blue lines, but nothing helped and some made it worse. I don't know if it was because they tasted bad or made her belly hurt or both, but it was a huge relief to find this Blue Wilderness food. She is incredibly picky, but actually seems to like it and no longer has the digestive problems. It made a huge difference for her within just a day or two... if you're in the same situation and starting to feel desperate, definitely give this food a try.
customer_reviews.author: KatzenBooks

customer_reviews.title: Happy cats with this food
customer_reviews.text: My cats think this is the best thing other than a live mouse for their meals. I don't buy it all the time, but on occasion I give it to them to break the monotony of their same daily food, and it's quite a treat for them. It is a nutritious food made with good ingredients and is grain-free. They're happy little kitties to see it in their food bowls. I noticed that they drink more water with this dry food, so keep the water bowls full.
customer_reviews.author: S. Warfield

customer_reviews.title: Huge difference in my cat just within a month.
customer_reviews.text: I am personally giving 5 stars because this helped my cat tremendously. My cat had been on Iams for years, puked atleast every other day. The only reason I switched is because when I took her to the vet, she was 3lbs lighter then she was, so she had lost alot of weight. I immediately went and tried this new food for her and within a month, puked once and has gained her 3 lbs back, she is actually kind of chubby now. No problems with this food. Her coat also seems to be better and she looks alot fluffier. Worked for Sammy!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: My cat prefers this to other grain free.
customer_reviews.text: Of course my cat wanted to eat “junk food” (read: Whiskas) instead, but I wanted her to have something higher quality. She happily eats Blue Buffalo now and prefers it to other grain free brands. The pieces are small and dusted with some kind of flavoring which she likes. I still indulge her with 9 lives canned food, which she really likes and meows for, though the cheap cans sometime upset her tummy. Think I’ll switch to a higher quality can once she finishes this lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chrys D Thorsen

customer_reviews.title: Need added Taurine!!!
customer_reviews.text: New info on the affects of potatoes, peas and all legumes on Taurine give me great concern on this food. I am using it but with a cat supplement with taurine - Life Extension for cats on Amazon. I would think older cats and those with heart problems may be affected by the reduced amount of Taurine due to the potatoes and peas.
customer_reviews.author: GZN

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great food just will NEVER order this from Amazon ever again.
customer_reviews.text: Thai food came old blanched out and lots of crumbles. It was NOT out of date but the food was either stored hot or something happened to it. The contents did not look or smell like the fresh tight bags I buy at the pet store. I ended up feeding this to my dogs. My cats are too delicate to have taken a chance with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Touchton

customer_reviews.title: Life saving food
customer_reviews.text: My cat wouldn’t eat after the death of her brother. I tried a couple different brands and nothing enticed her to eat. I was in the pet store and a rep from Blue Buffalo suggested their grain free line Blue Wilderness. I bought a small bag and my cat ate the whole 1/4 cup. It’s been 3 years now and she still loves the duck flavor as much as she did that first day. She’s now considered geriatric but this food fuels her love of play, keeping her active and agile. I highly recommend this food.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L Culpepper

customer_reviews.title: My cat Loves this !
customer_reviews.text: Even dry my cat loves this. We have an outdoor cat that the neighbors left behind and I didn't want it to starve. Thankfully he loves this and comes around twice a day begging for his food. I even put this on auto-delivery because I know he's not going to stop eating it anytime soon. As for quality, I've seen no problems yet. Fresh and ready to eat. I do keep a bowl of water nearby for him to drink since this is dry food. So far he's getting fat. His stool is just about right and I've seen no behavior or other health issues others are talking about so far.
customer_reviews.author: gilbryans

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Older Cat Healthy
customer_reviews.text: My cat does well on Blue Buffalo. He became tired of the Sensitive Stomach formulation (which he was on for over eight years), so I switched to the wilderness formulation. He loves them all! I switch them every month, so he doesn't cop an attitude again. Although he is self-feeding and somewhat pudgy from kittenhood, he has lost a half pound on this formula. Which he needed to do in order to prevent diabetes and arthritis. For me, a healthy older cat is wroth some extra expense for quality kibble, although this is far from the most expensive no-grain brand.
customer_reviews.author: firstgirl2

customer_reviews.title: My cats know the difference between Blue Wilderness and any other top notch cat food I give them
customer_reviews.text: I have four cats they tend to eat the Blue Wilderness first until the bowl is empty and then they will go for whatever other food I have out for them. They look at me when that bowl is empty even though they have other food, and just wait for the Blue Wilderness. They all know the difference and enjoy that food the most. The only negative thing I have to say about it, is that it is too expensive. I limit the cats to just a certain amount of Blue Wilderness per day when I would actually like to give them more. I just can't afford it with four cats.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Hessels

customer_reviews.title: Lasts longer than cheap food and desired by cats.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone from meow mix to this and everywhere in between. Meow mix created digestive problems for 3 different cats. I was using a brand one step below this with more meat ingredients but they lowered their quality and raised the price. I moved on to this brand and my cats have no issues chowing down. I thought this might be on the pricey side but they seem to get more full off less food so it lasts a lot longer. No digestive issue either. Please invest in quality food such as this for your pets health. Vet bills cost a lot more than decent quality food.
customer_reviews.author: DirtyEJ20

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted two cats with FIV in November 2017, so I needed a healthier cat food option. I tried other dry cat food, but they had fillers and grains in them which caused a blockage in one cat's esophagus. After a trip to the emergency vet, the Dr. recommended wet food, which gets costly and smelly. After 6 months, I asked my vet if there's any dry cat food options I could try. He suggested Blue Buffalo Wilderness. After 3 weeks, my cats have more energy, & no blockages! They took to the food immediately and come running when they hear me open the bag at feeding time. Thank you Blue Buffalo!!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Fabio

customer_reviews.title: My kitty is back
customer_reviews.text: My kitty is old(18 yrs) and seems to be stiff, slow moving. I bought this for her and I think I can see a difference in her already! She’s been eating this for about five days. She even seems to be happier. She is a bit of a picky eater (no way!) and she loves this! Will definitely buy again! Thank you for bringing my kitty back!
customer_reviews.author: the shopper

customer_reviews.title: Recommend - good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased that to have better food for my younger cat because he started to have some health issues. My older cat used to different food and they had different food for a while. But over time my older cat quit eating her old favorite food, and completely switched to this one. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Tais

customer_reviews.title: Vet Says, "Keep It Up" for Blue Buffalo
customer_reviews.text: My adopted cats were given Blue Buffalo the first day they came home. Neither the Persian nor the Domestic Shorthair have been to the vet for any illness or problem. The Persian is eight years old and the Domestic Shorthair is 13. My vet says, "Keep it up." I usually give them the Wild Salmon, but on occasion I give them Duck. My cats are so domesticated they won't stinky sardines, tuna, or salmon. They chow down the Blue Buffalo. And I say, "Keep It Up."
customer_reviews.author: S Jane Fisher

customer_reviews.title: The cats always try to rip into the bag because they LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats. They have eaten this for the past 8+ years without issue. When they eat it, I can hear them say "nomnomnom" as they gobble it down. That's why I gave 5 stars for flavor. They know when it's in the box and try to rip into it. If the bag is left out, they bite and claw through it. That's why I give 5 stars for scent. The whole reason we started giving this to our cats was the ingredient quality, another 5 stars. Average it all together and it's 5 stars. I get it on auto delivery which is extremely convenient and saves money too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Allen

customer_reviews.title: BLUE Indoor is great. My 8 rescues love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 inside cats and 4 outside. They completely agree on the otherBLUE DRY CAT FOOD. LOVE IT. Nobody likes this one. I would have returned but Tuesday the 29th...I’m having serious back surgery. So guess I’m stuck. You see I’ve again ordered the previous Blue. Sure don’t have this kind of money. But the Blue Indoor is awesome. Coats are now beautiful and healthy. These are all rescues that I’m doing the best I can for.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Farr

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having it been recommended by my sister. We still had some of our old brand of cat food left, so I was finishing up that bag of food, but the cats stopped eating it, and instead ate through the Blue Buffalo bag to eat that food...so I guess they prefer it... 🤔😏😂
customer_reviews.author: AwesomeSauce

customer_reviews.title: Yummy to his tummy
customer_reviews.text: Well not entirely sure if this helps our fat cat get any slimmer but it at least stops him from getting fatter so that’s good. He loves his blue buffalo and is always super excited when breakfast and dinner come around. He gets a quarter cup at each meal so only a half a cup a day and that has helped him “maintain” so there’s that. We also feel good knowing he has a high quality kibble to eat so he’s getting the best.
customer_reviews.author: Sams_Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled Kitty Cats
customer_reviews.text: Both my 13 year old cat and my 4 year cat love this cat food. They have always been good about eating whatever brand I put in their bowl, but (ugh) sometimes it came up. As soon as I open the bag, they are there. They go through it, probably twice as fast as any other cat food.They don’t have a problem with it...it stays down. I’m going to continue buying this for them because it makes them happy. A small price to pay....Because they make me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Poling

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Didnt even have it for 2 days till my cat started throwing up everywhere. Diarrhea all over. Never been so shocked & disgusted with a cat food brand. I switched her food a different brand and now shes fine. For the price I paid it is terrible to even think it's worth $5. Dollar store cat food doesnt make my cat that sick! Never again will I buy this brand!
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: It's Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who is a health freak. She doesn't like certain low quality cat foods (the others eat it and she will eat it if there isn't anything else) and she'd rather eat cilantro and bananas than her own cat food. She did, however LOVE this cat food, so much to the point of tearing a hole in the side of the bag and spilling it everywhere. I can't afford to buy this all the time just because I have too many animals and pets are costly BUT I will try to get this more frequently since the overall quality is better than Purina or Iams.
customer_reviews.author: Guest732

customer_reviews.title: Helps my cat stop vomiting
customer_reviews.text: This dry cat food has much smaller sized parcels than the other dry foods we have purchased. This has helped our cat to stop vomiting due to expansion of the food when ingested. As far as ingredient quality, well, our cat has not died from malnutrition. Flavor, I haven't tasted it so I don't know. Our cat had to get used to it as she is very finicky to the point of running from a can of tuna. Scent, well, animals love the stinky stuff, we don't, so this is half good for us, half for the feline. I will purchase again. It would be nice if they also had a furrball formula.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Todd

customer_reviews.title: My 4 cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I have dry food out for my cats all day, and this is the first brand where they will consistently empty their bowls (even if it's been set out for a few days). In the past I've used cheaper, grocery brands and had cats with health issues such as crystallizing urine. Other brands also don't have a real meaty odor like this does, and the scent/flavors last down to the final morsel in the bag. My only complaint is this is not a resealable bag. I hope that's something they'll add in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea S.

customer_reviews.title: Improvement in cats health
customer_reviews.text: My cat's hair was thinning on her back to the point where even the vet asked if I had cut her hair. I started feeding her this food in hope that it being a better quality product maybe it would help, even if by a little. After a few weeks i started to notice her hair filling in and becoming thicker. She now has all her fluffiness back and looks great. It may be a little more pricey than other dry brands, but its well worth the price for how healthy she is.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Ash

customer_reviews.title: Short Description is incorrect!
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to let you know: Short Description says 2-lb. This is actually an 11-lb bag That said, Skeeter won't eat anything else! If you have a picky eater, give this a try. Skeeter has a "delicate" stomach and can't really tolerate lesser quality foods. He likes this flavor and it doesn't give him any distress. I also use it as a treat for the dogs, they love it too! Never too much, just a bit for being a "good dog"!! Better deal on subscription than any local pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: She does like it. (Maybe too much?)
customer_reviews.text: My new, just over 2-yr. old, very healthy shelter-rescue baby loves this cat food, but even though she is tiny and slim, the recommended daily serving (1/4 to 1/2 cup per day) never seems to be enough! I have been giving her at least 1/8th cup more than the maximum recommended amount. I don't want to overfeed her, but her pitiful cries between meals just breaks my heart. Some reviews mention their cats now eat less food because of the high protein in this cat food. Maybe my kitty just has a high metabolism?
customer_reviews.author: MunchkinsMomsez

customer_reviews.title: He does not recommend for cats
customer_reviews.text: Caused struvite chrystal’s in my Ragdoll. Vet took him off and told me not to feed him this food. He switched him to Royal Canin SO for urinary health. He does not recommend for cats.
customer_reviews.author: VJB

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Dude Puts All 4 Paws in The Air For This Cat Food, Well Almost...
customer_reviews.text: This Food is Kitty Dudes Fave, & The Crazy Thing is he Always Eats His Wet Food First an Then The Dry When He's Bored & Has The Munchies! But Now When i Give Him Wet & Dry @ The Same Time he Goes For The Dry First LOL...O & as an Added Bonus When he Does His Business, it Doesn't Result in a "Clean & Sweep" of my Crib, BOOOYAAAA!!! Or Should That be Hallelujah?...It's Definitely Gonna Help Out in The Romance Dept., When i Bring a Sweet Hotty Home...to Meet Kitty Dude of Course :-)P...
customer_reviews.author: Celtic Warrior Poet7

customer_reviews.title: My cats are happier and so much softer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This food is fabulous! I recently switched to this food at the vets suggestion as one of my cats had severe dandruff and was constantly scratching. My vet told me it was due to a poor diet after running a full blood panel. After switching, my cat now has no dandruff and both of my cats have much softer fur and seem so much healthier. I feel terrible that my cat was suffering while eating the other brand of cat food that indicated it was for sensitive skin and stomachs! So glad that I made this switch!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Bad Food
customer_reviews.text: I have always and still buy this product and my oriental shorthair cats love it too. Except for the order I received from Amazon. My cats kept vomiting and had bad stools, and at first I thought they were having problems with a sensitive stomach and I shrugged it off. Well finally they ate very little of this particular bag and then they stopped completely. I felt so bed my husband and I thought maybe it was this bag of food and we bought a fresh bag from Petsmart and they were gobbling it down! Poor things were starving and ate the bad food because of it.I'm wondering what is wrong with this food?
customer_reviews.author: paulaj48150

customer_reviews.title: Approved by cat ,but question consistency
customer_reviews.text: My cat is super picky but this is one that she usually will eat. I say usually because sometimes I just get a bag that she doesn't seem to like the smell of all the kibbles . Some of them she won't eat or she will chew on and leave crumbles in her bowl. So I'm not sure if it's a problem with the consistency or the cat. I do mix with another brand of food, and she doesn't seem to do the same with that food.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Great food, healthy happy cats, grain free life
customer_reviews.text: My cats have been eating Blue Buffalo for years and they do extremely well on it! Their coats, skin, and weight are all healthy (I let them eat freely and have since they were kittens, so they don't have any over-eating problems). This food is high in protein so they will have more energy and love play time so they can sprint around. I've noticed a significant difference in the health of my cats from feeding them grain free, as cats really shouldn't be eating omnivorously.
customer_reviews.author: Lenora

customer_reviews.title: Only food my cat can eat!
customer_reviews.text: The vet recommended so many of their special prescription foods, but every time my cat tried a new one he got sick. Also he would start eating my dog food (the dog version of this) and refused to eat all the prescription foods. Eventually the vet gave up and just said to stick with this food. Now that my cat has stuck with the same food for a couple of years his system is better and he's not as sickly.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Suess

customer_reviews.title: If Jesse loves it - It's a win!
customer_reviews.text: I like the smaller pellets. It does have a scent. I mean it's fish. So I guess this is to be expected. My boy Jesse loves it though so we are happy. I mix this with his prescription diet food which is expensive. It lasts longer now. I was also trying to find a food that was easy on his stomach and didn't make his stools smell so bad. With the two mixed it's a little better. I know this isn't anyone's favorite topic. But I know it matters to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Please we aware of Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Please don’t feed this to your cat, my cat started vomiting foam and then the food he ate. I was so worried and scared so many emotions went through my head. Then he calmed down, and went to sleep. He’s always throwing up this food, I figured that it was probably just that he didn’t chew it right until today, that he threw up foam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not cat approved (at least not my cat)
customer_reviews.text: I obviously can’t comment about the ingredients, flavor or scent, but my cat refused to eat it, so it gets 1 Star. Here’s hoping a shelter will take the bag minus one quarter cup missing. My cat ONLY eats dry food, no wet food, no tuna, chicken, steak, beef, sausage, cheese ... Not. A. Fan. I think he likes processed food, because he also didn’t like IAMS but loves Friskies.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was less expensive
customer_reviews.text: My cat was getting cat acne, and the vet recommended that she started a grain free diet. This is the best for both of my cats coats. The one that had acne no longer has issues. Of course she looks at me like "where is my fattening food" but she eats it. My male cat just gobbles it down...but he will eat whatever you put in front of him. I give it a 5 star for product...but price wise...it's not cheap. But they are happy and healthy and I can't complain OH...I also must say buying it on here is less than going to petsmart or petco.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Healthy ingredients that taste good
customer_reviews.text: This is a little pricey but well worth it for my picky eater kitty. She is a 24 yr old and was excuse my language vomiting everywhere. I had tried many foods and this one hit the spot. She loves the taste, it has no corn fillers and it has helped her with her digestion. She is a grazer so I fill her bowl and she eats just a little at time and it is easy enough for her to chew. Made with peas, sweat potatoes, salmon & has Omega 3's added with a lot of other healthy things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Improved fur coat and poop
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food! He’s been on it for a few months now and his coat is SO SHINY and soft. He had a little bit of a shedding issue when I first adopted him but his coat hasn’t been shedding at all, even though it’s currently changing seasons (they’re supposed to get a new coat). Also, his poop used to stink very badly and there is a noticeable difference. This is a great quality food that I’ll continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlynn Parks

customer_reviews.title: BAD QUALITY PACKAGING:  Will Follow Up on Food Quality
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t fed it yet; packaging bag for cat food is so lame that my babes could smell and claw in when it was in a separate location from all other food. BAD! Especially at this price point. Never happened to me with any cat food before. Will follow up on food quality.
customer_reviews.author: CatWoman

customer_reviews.title: Busted bag
customer_reviews.text: Product arrive damaged. Bag was busted and the food was spilled into the shipping box. I won't feed my animals from an open possibly contaminated bag of food. Of course it's not eligible for return so i wasted $30.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Cat didn't even taste it
customer_reviews.text: My cat who eats literally everything including carrot, broccoli, cottage cheese, etc didn't even taste this holistic food. I guess because my cat is eating fresh meat from his kitten age. I did try it just see if any dry food may be given to him as an emergency food. Nope. He was dead hungry but smell the food and turn around with bad look at me. Saying what the hell are you offering me? Honestly, I sniff it and agree with my smart ass. Donated to local shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Keep your cats healthy!
customer_reviews.text: My cats have been on this formula for years. I was free feeding and they got fat. Put them on a vet recommended diet cat food and one developed diabetes. The ingredients in the “diet” cat food was primarily corn! Ugh! No wonder he developed diabetes! I had to put that one down. Decided to go back to this formula and crate feed. That was four years ago and my three remaining seniors are doing well!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet M Downs

customer_reviews.title: My older house cat
customer_reviews.text: As the years have ticked by, my furbaby has picked up many sensitive to food. She stated on science diet had that many years then a few years ago we switched over to Blue but now having sensitive reactions to grain this was amazing to keep her on Blue and provide this great tasting food which she loves and seeing her skin heal and fur grow back... healed my heart. This is a must for your sensitive furbaby. She is my side kick and happy and playing again.. thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mindie Sue Sposari

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves This Food!
customer_reviews.text: This is my cat's favorite food. I have tried a couple other brands, but she does not enjoy them as much. Also, some other brands I have tried have caused her to have dandruff or become sick. She is very excited for breakfast and dinner everyday and always eats everything I give her. She even managed to sneak into the closet where I keep the food one day and ripped the bag open to get some more... haha. I will definitely be continuing to purchase Blue Buffalo cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: My cats are too picky
customer_reviews.text: I wish my cats would like it as it is nutritionally superior to the popular brands, but it costs more and my cats are too finicky and preferred the cheaper brands. I tried mixing the two and they only ate the cheap stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Renniebaby

customer_reviews.title: The Best of the Best Cat Food
customer_reviews.text: If you need dry food for your Cat, this is the best option. My cat is crazy for this recipe and the rabbit. This was listed as the" best of the best" dry cat food you can buy. My cat is indoor and outdoor. He loves this food. He will eat this first before he eats his Albacore Tuna.
customer_reviews.author: MacGayver

customer_reviews.title: Better for my cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats seem to like the taste. I have no opinion since I haven't tried it at all. I do like that it has no fillers and first ingredient is meat. Just wish it wasn't so high priced for the better cat foods.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Better late than never doesn’t apply here.
customer_reviews.text: My four cats love this food. They love it so much we put it on a 30 day subscription. This is where the problem is. It’s ALWAYS late or gets cancelled completely. Which leaves us scrambling when it finally runs out. Cancelling with Amazon and just going “brick and mortar”
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great for different cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, one is 1 year old and the other is 6 years old. They have completely different energy levels but they both love this food. They both maintain a healthy weight even though the 6 year old sleeps all day. The 1 year old seems to have so much more energy since I put her on this food.. she's such a handful! lol but they are both happy and healthy so I will continue to buy this food. I buy the chicken in the purple bag. I have tried the indoor chicken in the blue bag but they don't seem to like that one as much.
customer_reviews.author: StarDust

customer_reviews.title: My cats didn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: Ate it first day then walked away . Expensive product to sit and , further spoil .
customer_reviews.author: J.L J

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite.
customer_reviews.text: Been buying this from Amazon since August 2016 and my cat loves it. Tried the Red Meat and the Chicken variety and she won't touch either -- just her duck so you know what -- I just buy the Blue Wilderness Duck and she loves it. Never vomits outside of the occasional hair ball vomit that has no food in it. Has developed no health issues. As long as I don't change her Blue Wilderness Duck, she's a very happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: I Heart Amazon

customer_reviews.title: It will save in Vet bills.
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my cats (and dogs) this brand of food for 15 + years. I can't literally say how it tastes...lol, but my animals like it. I alternate flavors so they don't get bored, but they never seem to mind eating the same thing. They never get sick, so even though it seems more expensive, it actually has saved me money in vet bills. Their coats are shiny and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn A

customer_reviews.title: My cats eat it
customer_reviews.text: I have changed foods on my cats several times to get them to eat the ones that are not made with road kill. No, turned their delicate little noses up at everything, so I figured why not try the most expensive one our there and of course, they love it. Doesn't smell like cat food either. If they are willing to eat it, then I will stick with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley M.

customer_reviews.title: Love the quality and better yet cats love it the best of all flavors.
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it, I love the quality of food that is in product. IF I was to say anything against product it goes for most cat food now days. That is what I do NOT like is that the food is smaller and doesn't give the cats a chance to have to chew as much so it would also help clean their teeth. This is certainly not against the company but my pet peive about most hard cat food now days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Women

customer_reviews.title: Me and my cat are happy with it :)
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before picking a cat food and this is a great compromise of quality/price/availability. My cat loves it. She has unlimited access to her food and is at a healthy weight. She also gets wet food from the same brand. On the uploaded picture it's her, eating her kibbles over steak...
customer_reviews.author: Romane

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy anything else.
customer_reviews.text: My Maine Coon is a picky eater. I've tried the recommended Royal Canin Maine Coon food, Life's Abundance (as recommended by the breeder), Taste of the Wild and Natural Balance. I've found that he actually loves BLUE Wilderness Salmon flavor. He's been eating for over a year now. He's a healthy 25 lbs, normal for Coonie. This is perfect since it's high protein. His fur is shiny (maybe due to the fact that he gets tuna every other day) and at 7 years old he has so much energy, he acts like a kitten! I won't feed him anything but BLUE Wilderness now.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food for my cats because they’re approaching 6 years and I want to be vigilant with their health as they move into their senior years. It’s been about 2-3 months of them eating it and they both puke now almost every day for the last couple weeks. I couldn’t track which cat was puking until today when I witnessed both of them puke in front of me at different times. Now I’ve been researching this product and see that puking is a similar side effect other people’s cats have had from this food too. Going straight in the trash and will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie gibbens

customer_reviews.title: the quality of the food has gone way down hill.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has been eating this since I adopted her but this last bag I received seems off the bits are much smaller and a scoop weighs less than a scoop from her old bag shes been scratching like crazy i don't know what they have done to the recipe but the food is no good.
customer_reviews.author: claire whitney

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my cat. She loved it from the first bowl. Did my research before buying this brand and product. This is really good for cats as it has high protein content, which is beneficial for their development.
customer_reviews.author: M.N.C

customer_reviews.title: Makes their fur really soft
customer_reviews.text: I bought the salmon flavor. It makes my cats' fur insanely soft. Guests always comment on how soft the cats' fur feels. I've had the cats taste test several brands and how they like this one varies from cat to cat. All of them will eat it, some of them prefer it, and some of them prefer other brands. I tasted this myself too, because I was curious; it tastes like spinach. This food does not have a fishy odor, even though it contains salmon. This food seems to reduce the frequency of vomiting for the two cats I have who are prone to vomiting occasionally; I think the vomiting was a food allergy and this food seems to help.
customer_reviews.author: Akama

customer_reviews.title: Finally my Bengal cat loved dry food❤️
customer_reviews.text: Honestly Amazing!!!! My Bengal cat never ate dry food. I tried so many brands from Costco and Pets Mart but he never liked any dry food. This is the only one that he ate from. I’m so happy and I hope that he will gain some weight. Obviously he loved the salmon flavor😊 I’m so happy and thank you for all the positive reviews; it helped me choose this brand👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Danah

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves this food.
customer_reviews.text: I am cat sitting a friends cat for 1 month. My friend sent a bag of another brand of cat food that I was worried about because the cat did not eat very much of his existing food. I purchased this brand and the cat loves it. He does not hesitate to eat what I put out of this food. Although not a bad smell, the smell is strong when the bag is open.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat eats it!
customer_reviews.text: I used a different brand for years until my local pet store stopped carrying it. I went through several different brands before I found this. And he likes it. So we are good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Coloradobloom

customer_reviews.title: My cats are crazy about this
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old Mr Weasely always KNOWS when this stuff arrives. We get packages often, but he can tell when its kitty food and goes nuts over it. All 4 of our kitties love this food.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Voetsch

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: The only food brand we feed my kitty. We adopted her from the humane society, and when we first got her (tmi) her litterbox stunk terrible and her hair was short and greasy looking. Once she had this food for about a week it was very low odor. I believe its because of the quality ingredients. Shes close to 4 and still acts like a kitten, has loads of energy and her coat is so soft, grew really long and looks healthy. (Shes a long haired Himalayan)
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Brooks

customer_reviews.title: No more vomiting!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only dry cat food that doesnt make my cat throw up. There is something to be said about grainfree food. That means no GMO products which can cause digestive upset, cancer and tumors. I also love that this doesnt have needless and harmful food colorings and chemicals. Feed your fur baby the best!
customer_reviews.author: Paradise*Gardens

customer_reviews.title: Only dry cat food I'll buy!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties ONLY eat Blue Buffalo dry cat food. I blend the Indoor with the Chicken and Duck flavors, and they eat it up! I feel very secure knowing that there is a high amount of protein in lieu of grains. I have a 15 year old tabby, and an 18 month kitten. Since I always have dry food available, my little guys have to be on the same food, instead of a senior formula, and kitten. I'm content with Blue Buffalo's standards, and know my babies are getting the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Worthington

customer_reviews.title: My cat's say "yes, please!"
customer_reviews.text: My cat's LOVE this brand and flavor! I have 3 black cats and all of them love this.
customer_reviews.author: Damita J.

customer_reviews.title: First ingredients mostly animal-based!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats go absolutely wild for this variety of pet food, and after reading the ingredient listing, I can see why! No corn, wheat, soy, etc to be seen at the top of the ingredient list, just animal product and, for the most part. I believe there is some pea protein and tapioca starch used, but the vast majority of ingredients used are very much suitable for my carnivorous little babbies. A little on the pricey side, but if you mix this with a less expensive variety of food, it lasts fairly long and keeps your cats tummies happy and healthy as well :~)
customer_reviews.author: B34rHands

customer_reviews.title: Smaller, less smelly poops indicate better digestibility than other foods I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: My pets love this food, and they have much better quality poops. It's relatively expensive, but it's worth it. Also, one cat who was having coat problems (she licked herself bald on her belly and both flanks) regrew all her fur after years of looking mangey and trying many different brands of food!
customer_reviews.author: mfskarphedin

product_meta.title: Blue Buffalo Wilderness High Protein, Natural Adult Dry Cat Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Chicken| Size:12 lbInspired by the diet of the lynx, a tireless and legendary hunter, BLUE Wilderness is a protein-rich, grain-free food that contains more of the delicious meat cats love. BLUE Wilderness is a product of the Blue Buffalo company. Based in the United States, Blue Buffalo makes premium-quality pet foods featuring real meat, fruit and vegetables.
feature_bullets: PACKED WITH REAL CHICKEN: Made to feed your feline’s wild side, this high protein cat food is packed with more of the chicken cats crave to help build and maintain lean muscle mass.

GRAIN FREE CAT FOOD: BLUE Wilderness grain free adult cat food is made with healthy carbohydrates including sweet potatoes and peas to help fuel your cat’s active lifestyle. Plus, it contains omega 3 & 6 fatty acids to support skin and coat health.Calorie Content: 3,832 Kcals/kg, 443 Kcals/cup

WITH LIFESOURCE BITS: This formula contains BLUE’s exclusive LifeSource Bits – a precise blend of antioxidants, vitamins and minerals carefully selected by holistic veterinarians and animal nutritionists to support immune system health, life stage requirements, and a healthy oxidative balance.

NATURAL CAT FOOD: BLUE dry cat food is formulated for the health and well-being of your adult cat and features the finest natural ingredients enhanced with vitamins and minerals. It never contains chicken (or poultry) by-product meals, corn, wheat, soy, artificial flavors or preservatives.
Contains one (1) 12-lb bag of BLUE Wilderness High Protein Grain Free, Natural Adult Dry Cat Food, Chicken. Healthy skin and coat

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
